channel.title: A DAMN MOVIE PODCAST
channel.description: A theme based movie podcast that offers in depth reviews of films across the whole spectrum of film history from the silent era to modern day classics and new releases. Accompanied by our never ending film festivals, interviews and top 5's we will enthrall you with ridiculousness, knowledge and humor. We drink, we curse, and most reviews contain spoilers, so be weary. Voted Best New Podcast by SLC's City Weekly come be a fly on the wall of our conversations about the art form that we love with the ever so cultured and hilarious Adam Sherlock and Adam Palcher.

item.title: #221 - Fatal Attraction / Hannah and Her Sisters / Punishment Review: Double Dragon
item.description: Well, what am I supposed to do? You won't answer my calls, you change your number. I mean, I'm not gonna be ignored, Dan! Here we go, you guys! One of the weirdest match ups we have ever done! At first, it was supposed to be about infidelity, but then we mixed in the punishment review, so this episode is about....relationships? Maybe? Is that a stretch? At any rate, we throw together Adrian Lyne's terrifying Fatal Attraction with the last installment of the Woody Allen fest, Hannah and Her Sisters. Then Sherlock does his punishment review of Double Dragon. Next episode, we start the second film Westival!

item.title: #220 - Last Action Hero / The Purple Rose Of Cairo
item.description: This is gonna work. It's a movie, I'm a good guy. This has got to work! Oh, sh*t! I'm a comedy sidekick! IT'S NOT GONNA WORK! This week we break apart reality, the fourth wall, logic and then some! First, it is the 1993 action movie send-up with Last Action Hero. Then we get into the fourth installment of our Woody Allen festival, The Purple Rose Of Cairo. No Top 5 this week, sorry!

Finally, our top 5 Behind The Scenes Movies.

Then, it's Guillermo Del Toro's turn with 2013's Pacific Rim. Wait, that HAS to be a euphamism for something... Right?

item.title: #216 - Minority Report / Sleeper / Top 5 Movie Robots
item.description: Sometimes, in order to see the light, you have to risk the dark. This week we head into the future! First, the 2003 Speilberg dark fantasy, Minority Report. Then, our second installment of the Woody Allen festival with 1973's Sleeper. Finally, top 5 movie robots. Enjoy!

item.title: #215 - The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty / Midnight In Paris / Top 5 Daydreamers
item.description: To see the world, things dangerous to come to, to see behind walls, draw closer, to find each other, and to feel. That is the purpose of life. This week we leave the comfort of our safe little lives and see the world! Well, sort of. To kick off our Woody Allen festival, we pair up 2011's whimsical comedy Midnight In Paris with the new Ben Stiller comedy, The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty. Then, top 5 daydreamers. Plus, Sherlock's curmugeoned rant about the beloved new Lego movie.

item.title: #214 - Heat / Point Break
item.description: I do what I do best, I take scores. You do what you do best, try to stop guys like me. Well, we are ending the Swayzfest with one hell of a badass team-up! First, Michael Mann's 1995 heist film, Heat. Then, the almighty Point Break. Special guest this week, Fuzz!

item.title: #213 - The Worlds End / Roadhouse / Top 5 Movie Bars
item.description: I remember sitting up there, blood on my knuckles, beer down my shirt, sick on my shoes and seeing the orange glow of a new dawn break and knowing in my heart life would never feel this good again. And you know what? It never did. This week it's all about the bars, folks! We start off with the third film of Edgar Wrights homage to action/horror films with World's End. Then we dip into the fourth installment of our Swayzefest with Roadhouse. Finally, our top 5 movie bars. Thanks for listening!

item.title: #212 - Hedwig and The Angry Inch / To Wong Foo, Thanks For Everything, Julie Newmar / Top 5 Gender Bending Roles
item.description: How did some slip of a girly boy from communist East Berlin become the internationally ignored song stylist barely standing before you? This week, we consider how over-rated traditional gender identity can be. We start with the epic rock musical, Hedwig and the Angry Inch, and then get into the third installment of our Swayze-fest with To Wong Foo, Thanks For Everything, Julie Newmar. Finally, top 5 gender bending roles. Enjoy!

item.title: #205 - Downfall / The Pianist / Top 5 WW2 Movies
item.description: Traitors! I've been betrayed and deceived from the very beginning! What a monstrous betrayal of the German people, but all those traitors will pay. They'll pay with their own blood. They shall drown in their own blood! Alright everybody. It is time for our riotous, laugh a minute holocaust episode! Just kidding. Serious subject matter here. But, we are able to squeeze a couple of jokes out. Mainly at Steven Speilberg's expense. First, the 2004 german film Downfall, followed by our fourth installment of the Polanski festival, The Pianist. Finally, Top 5 WW2 films. Enjoy!

item.title: #203 - The Conjuring / Pet Semetary / Top 5 Horror Movie Moms
item.description: Diabolical forces are formidable. These forces are eternal, and they exist today. The fairy tale is true. The devil exists. God exists. And for us, as people, our very destiny hinges upon which one we elect to follow. Happy Halloween everybody! This episode, the Adams are joined by Sherlock's lovely wife, Abby. They are going to review two films where families are torn apart by supernatural events. First, James Wan's new horror offering, The Conjuring. Then, they review the 1989 cheeseball classic Pet Semetary. Finally, top 5 horror movie moms. Sorry for the sound quality on this one. I think it's time for a new microphone!

item.title: #200 - Jaws / Listener voicemails!

All this machine does is swim and eat and make little sharks, and that's all. Alright everybody! It is the special 200 episode, where we spend a good amount of time looking back at your choice for our special review of Steven Speilberg's blokbuster, Jaws! Along with that, our collection of voicemails from fans. This sucker came out a day late due to the epic voicemail of one mr. Mark Middlemas! You will understand once you hear it. I'm pretty sure we will need a bigger boat! Thanks everybody!

This week it is all about the noir mysteries! We start with the 1941 Humphry Bogart film, THe Maltese Falcon, and then move into our first installment of our Polanski festival with Chinatown. item.title: #198 - The Master / Fall From Grace / Top 5 Spiritual Leaders
item.description: Man is not an animal. We are not a part of the animal kingdom. We sit far above that crown, perched as spirits, not beasts. I have unlocked and discovered a secret to living in these bodies that we hold. Indeed. This week, it's all about the charasmatic, frightening world of cults, religious movements and the people who lead them. We start with P.T. Anderson's 2012 film The Master, then finish off the You Should See This festival with the Fred Phelps Documentary, Fall From Grace. Finally, top five spiritual leaders. Be sure to call and leave us something for our 200th episode! 707-408-ADMP

item.title: #197 - Battlefield Earth / Top 5 Failed Franchises
item.description: You are out of your skull bone if you think that I am going to write on the report "shot by man-animal" as the cause of the death unless I see it! Oh puny humans, this special episode of A Damn Movie Podcast will make you happier than a baby Psychlo on a straight diet of kerbango. Whatever the hell that is. Palcher is out of town so Sherlock is joined by his brother Jay for a real unique punishment. John Travolta's offering of the WORST MOVIE EVER MADE. That's right, Battlefield Earth. Along with that, top 5 failed movie franchises. Enjoy (if that is the right word!)

item.title: #196 - The Incredible Hulk / Chronicle / General Orders No. 9
item.description: Don't make me hungry. You wouldn't like me when I'm hungry. This week we are joined by longtime contributor, blogger, podcast producer and all around good guy, Gavin Sheehan. We dissect the superhero mythos for a while with 2008's The Incredible Hulk, then take a look at the innovative found footage superhero tale, Chronicle. Finally, we skip the top 5 and instead review Robert Persons strange and hypnotic personal poem to the south, General Orders No. 9. Next week, we break from the usual for another installment of Cinema Doofus!

item.title: #195 - Dogville / The Arbor / Top 5 Unconventional Films
item.description: Oh Grace, I think you have plenty to offer the town of Dogville. Some heavy stuff this week, folks! We start with trying to sift through the misery and mystery of Lars Von Triers experimental morality tale, Dogville. Then we get into the third installment of Palcher's You Should See This Festival, The Arbor. A 2010 documentary/experimental film about the life of british playwright Andrea Dunbar, and how her abuse and addiction affected the lives of her children. Then we get into our Top 5 unconventional films. Don't forget to call in and leave feedback for our 200th episode!! 1-707-408-ADMP (2367)

Anyhow, first we start with the 1975 cult classic, Death Race 2000, and then get into our second installment of the You Should See This festival with the Wachowski's 2008 living cartoon, Speed Racer. item.title: #172 - The Greatest Movie Ever Sold / Reality Bites / Matt Whittaker Interview
item.description: The goal of this whole podcast is transparency. You're going to see the whole thing take place from beginning to end. This week we take a look at selling out.  How does trying to buy into the Hollywood dream affect artistic vision?  Our first take is 2011's Morgan Spurlock documentary, The Greatest Movie Ever Sold.  We then go to our second installment of the 90's comedy festival, Ben Stiller's Reality Bites.  We also have Matt Whittaker from the Salt Lake City Film Festival stop by to tell us about this years festival films.  Enjoy!

item.title: #171 - Office Space / Clerks / Top 5 Worst Jobs Portrayed in Film
item.description: So I was sitting in my cubicle today, and I realized, ever since I started working, every single day of my life has been worse than the day before it. So that means that every single day that you see me, that's on the worst day of my life.  This labor day, we take a look at the unsung workers with their menail irritating jobs, and the movies about them!  We start with Mike Judge's cult classic Office Space, and then start our 90's comedy festival with 1994's Clerks, the film that started the View Askew empire!  To round it all out, our top 5 worst jobs portrayed in film.  Cheers!

item.title: #159 - Drive / Martha Marcy May Marlene / Top 5 Anticipated Films For 2012
item.description: There's a hundred-thousand podcasts in this city. You give me a time and a place, I give you a two hour window. Anything happens in that two hours and I'm yours. No matter what. Anything happens a minute either side of that and you're on your own. Do you understand?  This week, we take a look at two newer releases, something that doesn't happen all that often on this show.  First, we review Ryan Gosling's stylish, violent thriller Drive, and then Elizabeth Olsen in the quietly paranoid drama Martha Marcy May Marlene.  We bring it all together with our Top anticipated movies for the rest of 2012.  Enjoy!

item.title: #150 - The Graduate / Top 5 Movies That Spoke To A Generation
item.description: I've got one word for you, kid.  Podcasts!  Welcome to our 150th episode!  This week we review the movie you guys voted for, The Graduate.  Then we get into a little bit of talk about our show, and try not to get too sappy.  We round things out with our top 5 movies that spoke to the generation that went to see them.  Thanks for downloading and send us feedback!

item.title: #149 - Its A Wonderful Life / Holiday Movie Cliches
item.description: Daddy, look! Every time a podcast is downloaded, an Adam gets his wings!  Ah yes.  This week we take a look at the holiday classic by Frank Capra and Jimmy Stewart, It's A Wonderful Life.  Suicide, drunken rage, squandered dreams and forclosure grief, it's the feelgood movie for the whole family.  Then we delve into the worst holiday movie cliches we could dredge up.  Light the log and spike the nog and get cosy!  Plus, send feedback!

item.title: #148 - Dirty Harry / Shaft / Top 5 Branded Characters
item.description: I know what you're thinking, is it episode 148 or 149?  Well, to tell you the truth, in all of this excitement, I kind of lost track myself.  But being as this is A Damn Movie Podcast, the most powerful podcast in the world that would blow your ears clean off, you gotta ask yourself, do you feel lucky?  This week, we look at two gritty action films from 1971, Dirty Harry and Shaft.  Along with an overview of Clint Eastwood's career, we do our top 5, Actors who have been associated with a role through their carreer.  Send us feedback and enjoy!

item.title: #147 - Blow / Superfly / Top 5 Last Job Movies
item.description: Sometimes you're flush and sometimes you're bust, and when you're up, it's never as good as you think it is, and when you're bust, you never think you'll be up again, but podcasting goes on.  This week we take a look at the 2001 Johnny Depp drug smuggling film, Blow.  Then it's time for our second installment of our blaxsploitation festival with Superfly.  We round things out with our Top 5 Last Job movies.  Send us feedback!

item.title: #146 - Hustle and Flow / The Mack / Top 5 Movies About Ambition
item.description: There are two types of people.  Those that talk the talk and those that walk the walk.  People who walk the walk sometimes talk the talk but most times they don't talk at all, 'cause they podcastin'.  This week, the Adams find out how hard it is out there for a pimp with the 2005 film Hustle and Flow.  We then begin our Blaxploitation festival with 1973's The Mack.  To tie it all together, we go with our top 5 movies about ambition.  Enjoy!

item.title: #145 - Poltergeist / Insidious
item.description: Happy Halloween everybody!  Join the Adam's this week when they are joined by Sherlock's lovely wife to review one of the best haunted house movies out there, Toby Hooper's 1982 Poltergeist.  Then, we take a look at this year's offering, James Wan's Insidious.  We also take a look at the some of the history of horror, and what it takes to scare us.  Hope you enjoy!

item.title: #144 - The Truman Show / We Live In Public / Top 5 Surveillance Films
item.description: While the world they inhabit is, in some respects, counterfeit, there's nothing fake about the Adams themselves.  No scripts, no cue cards.  It isn't always Shakespeare, but it's genuine.  It's a podcast.  This week we wrap up our Peter Weir festival with the 1998 groundbreaking The Truman Show.  Then we take a closer look at what 24 hour media coverage can do to a life in the documentary We Live In Public.  Then we rattle off our Top 5 Surveillance films.  Enjoy!

item.description: I'm going to paraphrase Thoreau here... rather than love, than money, than fame, than fairness.....give me a podcast.  Join the Adams as they take a journey through some of the best man vs. nature films out there.  We start with Sean Penn's 2007 Into The Wild, and then look at Peter Weir's The Mosquito Coast.  Then, top 5 movies where nature is a character. Music this week from the brand new Mark Dago cd, Kill Screen!  Enjoy!

item.title: #141 - The Killing Fields / The Year Of Living Dangerously / Top 5 Reporters
item.description: They tell us God is dead. And now the Party, they call the uncle, will provide everything for us. The Enemy is inside us. No one can be trusted.  This week, we travel to the far side of the world for a look at foreign correspondants and the challenges they face on the job.  First is Roland Joffe's 1984 harrowing true story of Pol Pot's Cambodia, The Killing Fields. Then we take a look at our second installment of our Peter Weir festival, 1982's The Year Of Living Dangerously, starring a incredibly young Mel Gibson. Then, our top 5 movie reporters. With Palcher out of town last week, and Sherlock gone this week, we were able to just squeeze this one in! Send us some feedback and rate us on itunes.

item.description: Sometimes when you win, you really lose, and sometimes when you lose, you really win.  And sometimes when you win or lose, you actually tie. And sometimes when you tie, you actually make a podcast about a stupid movie. This week, the boys are joined by Mr. Levi Lebo to review the 1992 Ron Shelton basketball comedy, White Men Can't Jump.  Along with the sports theme, we move into Steve James heartbreaking documentary, Hoop Dreams.  Then to tie it all together, we compare notes with our top 5 Movies That Aged Poorly.  Send us some feedback!

item.title: #137 - I Saw The Devil / Jee-woon Kim Interview
item.description: This week, join the Adams for a special review and interview segment of Jee-Woon Kim's 2010 South Korean revenge thriller, I Saw The Devil. First, Sherlock and Palcher delve into the plot and tone of the film itself, and then Palcher shares an exclusive interview with the director Jee-Woon Kim, as well as actor Byung-Hun Lee who plays the protagonist (sort of?) in the film.  Enjoy this short bonus episode, as the Adams have been taking time off from the podcast, busy making their own creepy serial killer film in the woods this week.  For reals!

This week we spend a sweaty, dirty summer day in New York City with Larry Clark's KIDS.  Along with that, we delve into the riveting Amish documentary, The Devils Playground.  Then, our top 5 Movies That Occur In A Single Day.  Enjoy!  Send Us Feedback!

item.description: Love is betrayal. Love is anguish. Love is sin. Love is selfish. Love is hope. Love is pain. Love is death. What is love? Love's a bitch. This week we delved deep into the multi themed and layered Amores Perros from Mexican director Alejandro González Iñárritu. item.description: Momma always said that you should listen to A Damn Movie Podcast.
